title: Everything You Need to Know About an Aries Sun-Pisces Moon

steps.title: Aries Sun-Pisces Moon people tend to be sensitive and thoughtful.
steps.content: Aries Sun-Pisces Moon people tend to be sensitive and thoughtful. These typically intelligent and introspective people prefer to live in the moment. Their Pisces Moon gives them strong intuition that their Aries Sun then tends to run with. They usually love to explore the world and discover new things, and they can have vivid imaginations. [1] X Research source Elements: fire (Aries), water (Pisces) [2] X Research source Planets: Mars (Aries), Jupiter and Neptune (Pisces) Aries Sun Traits: active, determined, self-confident, competitive [3] X Research source Pisces Moon Traits: intuitive, enthusiastic, compassionate, thoughtful [4] X Research source Famous People: Kourtney Kardashian, Sarah Michelle Gellar, James Woods

steps.title: Spiritual
steps.content: Spiritual Aries Sun-Pisces Moon people are often attracted to spirituality and philosophy. Because they also tend to be very thoughtful and have a mind that excels at research, they tend to make their own decisions about what to believe rather than mindlessly following the crowd. Their beliefs might seem contradictory to outsiders, but they hold onto the things that work for them and throw out the rest. Aries-Pisces folks occasionally take advice from others, but they tend to believe their way is the right way and would rather learn through experience. Their spirituality can be tied to this in that they're not likely to follow a religious or spiritual belief that doesn't feel true to them.

steps.title: Creative
steps.content: Creative The Moon in Pisces gives people with this combo a pretty strong imagination and an ability to express themselves artistically. Their sensitive, receptive nature allows them to pick up on the emotional qualities behind something, which they can then express through the arts, be that music, poetry, painting, or design. This creative drive leads many Aries-Pisces people towards a career in the arts, whether as a musician, actor, painter, or writer.

steps.title: Intuitive
steps.content: Intuitive It's no secret that water signs tend to be deeply intuitive, and having the Moon in Pisces means that Aries-Pisces folks tend to have an uncanny, almost psychic level of intuition. They just seem to have a sixth sense about what's going to happen, and they're usually right! [5] X Research source If an Aries Sun-Pisces Moon person shares their intuition, you can usually trust that they're correct. They also tend to be very reflective and thoughtful, so they've likely considered all the details—even things that tend to be less obvious to most people.

steps.title: Adventurous
steps.content: Adventurous Aries is an active sign, and people with this Aries-Pisces combination tend to be very on-the-go people. Because they usually want to experience new things, you won't catch the grass growing under their feet—they want to be where the action is. Don't be surprised to see an Aries-Pisces person planning a spontaneous road trip or booking a flight to a faraway land just because the fare happened to be low.

steps.title: Active
steps.content: Active People born with the Sun in Aries tend to have a reputation for being go-go-go, and an Aries-Pisces is no different. They're almost always going to have somewhere to go or something to do. If they have to sit still for too long, they're likely to end up angry or depressed by the stagnation. These active tendencies mean that Aries-Pisces people are usually traveling a lot and aren't interested in setting down roots in any particular place.

steps.title: Empathetic
steps.content: Empathetic The Pisces Moon brings a strong sense of compassion and empathy to the typical Aries-Pisces person. They tend to be very sensitive and have a strong understanding of the feelings of people around them. They can pick up on changes in people's moods well and are usually really good at understanding things from someone else's perspective. Their strong sense of empathy means that Aries-Pisces people typically know how to listen and provide emotional support to people who need it. For many Aries-Pisces people, this strong sense of empathy leads them to careers where they can help others, such as psychology or social work.

steps.title: Dedicated
steps.content: Dedicated When the typical Aries-Pisces person gets started on something, they don't stop until it's done to their high standards. They tend to be very goal-oriented and are always on the path of improvement. In relationships, they also tend to be very dedicated and loyal to their partner. Family and friends are typically very important to an Aries Sun-Pisces Moon. They might be particular about the people in their circle, but once you're in, they'd do anything for you. The Aries-Pisces' dedication combined with their intuitive nature means that they can foresee the way to accomplish the goals they've laid out. They tend to be more successful at reaching their goals than others.

steps.title: Receptive
steps.content: Receptive The typical Aries-Pisces is very open and sensitive to the mood and feelings of those around you. If there's one person you don't have to worry about not reading the room, it's the Aries-Pisces in your life. They seem to have an innate sense of what is appropriate. People born with the Sun in Aries and the Moon in Pisces also tend to pick up on qualities of people around them that no one else does. This helps them better understand how to approach any social situation.

steps.title: Insecure
steps.content: Insecure The typical Aries-Pisces person has a strong outer shell and might appear confident and self-assured on the outside. But on the inside, they often constantly compare themselves to others and feel that they don't measure up. This feeling of insecurity can cause them to doubt their own abilities. If you're an Aries-Pisces person, overcome this weakness by reminding yourself that you're only in competition with yourself. Try to focus on you rather than what other people are doing.

steps.title: Sensitive
steps.content: Sensitive Water signs are known for their sensitivity, and people with a Moon in Pisces tend to exemplify this trait. [6] X Research source Because of this, they may seem overly emotional at times and can be easily wound up by the words or actions of others. If you're an Aries-Pisces, try not to take things too personally . Recognize that any criticism typically isn't meant to hurt you, but rather to make you a better person.

steps.title: Impulsive
steps.content: Impulsive An Aries-Pisces tends to live in the moment, which can be a good thing! But the downside is that they might also come off as impulsive, especially to people who usually act with more caution. The Aries-Pisces person tends to follow their own intuition, and they're usually right. But when they're wrong, they can wind up getting themselves in trouble because they acted rashly. [7] X Research source Aries-Pisces, there's nothing wrong with following your intuition. But if you have problems with being impulsive, take time to sit and think things through before you act and you'll likely end up in fewer tight spots.

steps.title: Aries-Pisces people thrive in creative careers.
steps.content: Aries-Pisces people thrive in creative careers. Their creativity, sensitivity, and intuition make people with the Aries-Pisces combo gravitate toward the arts. They also have a strong drive, thanks to Aries, that pushes them to excel. Look for people born with the sun in Aries and the moon in Pisces to be musicians, writers, actors, or visual artists. Even in the corporate world, you're more likely to see an Aries-Pisces in a creative field, such as advertising or marketing.

steps.title: Aries-Pisces bonds best with fellow Fire-Water sign combos.
steps.content: Aries-Pisces bonds best with fellow Fire-Water sign combos. This includes the fire sun signs Aries, Leo, or Sagittarius in combination with the water moon signs Cancer, Scorpio, or Pisces. Because of their similar qualities, they'll likely find that they blend together really well. They might even feel as though they've always known each other. [8] X Research source At the same time, Aries-Pisces can be an extremely flexible combination, which means they'll potentially get along with a lot of different combinations. Aries-Pisces doesn't tend to get along well with people who are very temperamental or prone to extreme emotions.

steps.title: Aries-Pisces needs a partner who can stand up for themselves.
steps.content: Aries-Pisces needs a partner who can stand up for themselves. The Aries in this combo tends to make people more competitive and assertive, which means they could walk all over a more passive partner. People with this Sun-Moon combo tend to respect a partner who's willing to be assertive and won't back down when their needs aren't getting met. They also want their partner to be independent and have their own life. It's also important to be open to some spontaneity—expect anyone with this combo to be a little impulsive—especially about going to new places or trying new things. If you're in a relationship with an Aries-Pisces person, expect there to be some fireworks! People with this combo kind of enjoy conflict and appreciate a more argumentative style.

steps.title: In a relationship, this sun-moon combination is sensitive and protective.
steps.content: In a relationship, this sun-moon combination is sensitive and protective. The influence of the Pisces Moon tends to amp up these folks' sensitivity. They feel their own feelings and those of people close to them profoundly. As a result, they're pretty picky about who they let into their inner circle. Once you're in, though, expect an Aries-Pisces person to be really protective of you. They also like to be the one planning things and generally making the decisions, so they would prefer a partner who's willing to follow their lead. If you're in a relationship with someone who has this Aries-Pisces combination, try to be tactful to avoid triggering their sensitivity. They can have the tendency to get angry or lash out if they feel that they're not being treated with respect. Recognize that even though Aries-Pisces typically wants to take the lead, they will take your opinion into account before acting. Don't be afraid to let your feelings be known! However, they may not be drawn toward a partner that has a more dominant energy or is more social than them, since they prefer to be in charge. Reader Poll: We asked 709 wikiHow readers with a Pisces placement, and only 4% said their biggest deal breaker is their partner being less social than them . [Take Poll]

steps.title: The Aries Sun-Pisces Moon man is a deep thinker.
steps.content: The Aries Sun-Pisces Moon man is a deep thinker. An Aries-Pisces man can come across as something of a wise old soul, but that's only because he thinks about things a great deal before he acts on them. At the same time, he can get so carried away with thinking through something that he forgets to do anything else he has to. [9] X Research source Strengths: inquisitive, insightful, confident, upbeat Weaknesses: competitive, insecure, can be easily distracted In Love: gentlemanly, protective, romantic

steps.title: The Aries Sun-Pisces Moon woman is spirited and spontaneous.
steps.content: The Aries Sun-Pisces Moon woman is spirited and spontaneous. The charming, exciting Aries-Pisces woman typically spends a lot of her time and energy chasing down the next big thrill. She's usually not one to settle and will always keep her eyes focused on the horizon and what ways she can better herself and her life. [10] X Research source Strengths: gentle, charming, strong sense of humor, independent Weaknesses: unpredictable, reckless, can lack confidence in her own abilities In Love: romantic, passionate, self-sacrificing
